results.title: Have You Ever Thought?
results.creator_credit: Doreen Bentley and Christian Myles Productions
results.brief_description: A short documentary about the lives and the work of the Pastorelle Sisters, an order of Nuns in Thornbury, Melbourne. Their lives are centred around the person and teaching of Jesus, lived out in small communities, deeply concerned about the life of people, and working with clergy and laity in the building up of Christian communities.

results.title: Have I told you lately that I love you? (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A symbolic record of one day in the life of the members of an upper-middle-class American family, showing their dependence upon machines and the effect of automation on their relationships with one another.

results.title: Have a heart
results.creator_credit: Kaye Dyal, Ken Plotin, Saul Rubin and Tantalus Films
results.brief_description: Describes the function of the heart and circulatory system and emphasises the need for a healthy lifestyle to prevent heart disease. A heart attack victim is shown being given electric shock treatment. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Haunters of the deep
results.creator_credit: Andrew Bogle, Gordon L.T. Scott and Longbow Film Company
results.brief_description: In Cornwall, England, a big American company is about to re-open an abandoned tin mine, despite being warned against it. At the turn of the century the mine caved in and many miners were trapped beneath the surface. A ghost is sighted by a local boy - it is the ghost of one of the people trapped during the cave-in and it is trying to warn of disaster.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Bogle, Gordon L.T. Scott and Longbow Film Company

results.title: Harvesting the snows
results.brief_description: Surveys the Snowy Mountains Scheme - largest engineering project ever undertaken in Australia at the time. Outlines the plan for diverting the waters of the Snowy to the Murray. Shows the Guthega Dam and power station; construction in the Guthega Munyang tunnel; the plan for the [new] Adaminaby Dam and early stages of its construction.

results.title: Harry's half crown
results.creator_credit: Derek Logan, Jim Moody and Ushaw Moor Secondary Modern School
results.brief_description: Filmed during the period, September 1961 to March 1962 over 20 afternoons. This is a film by the students of Form 3A at Ushaw Moor Secondary School, County Durham, whereby the work included film teaching, scripting, location shooting, acting, music teaching, sound recording and film and sound editing. Scripted after their own stories, this amusing film is about a lower middle-class adolescent boy given the chore of buying groceries for his mother but spends the time mucking about with his friends and terrorising the neighbours. During this little outing, he spots a half crown coin lying in the gutter, which he splurges with his friends on sweets - but where has the grocery money gone?

results.title: Hardy Wilson: a living memory
results.brief_description: Hardy Wilson was an Australian architect and artist who acknowledged a climate that was non-European and designed houses and commercial buildings which were sympathetic to their surroundings. He was also a watercolourist, furniture designer, and a prolific social and philosophical writer. This film is of interest to an audience interested in Australian heritage and culture.

results.title: Hardi! Pardaillan
results.brief_description:
Pardaillan has been entrusted by King Henri III with a letter he must pass on to Henri de Bearn. King Henri is besieged in the city of Chartres and is asking for help. After surviving many ambushes, Pardaillan must also contend with a fanatical monk who is plotting against the king. This is the second installment of the adventures of Pardaillan. See also: ‘Le Chavalier de Pardaillan’ (X000503) in our collection.

Credits: Producer, Henri Jaquillard ; director, Bernard Borderie ; writers, Henri-Andre Legrand, Andre Haguet, Bernard Borderie ; photography, Henri Persin ; music, Paul Misraki ; costumes, Rosine Delamare.
Cast: Gerard Barray, Valerie Lagrange, Philippe Lemaire, Guy Delorme, Jean Topart.

results.title: Hard work
results.brief_description: A film about Margo St. James and her fight to have prostitution decriminalized. Revolving around the Hooker’s Convention in Washington, D.C., the action takes place over a five-day period. It includes a visit to the Women’s Detention Center, TV and press interviews, a congressional cocktail party, the Hooker’s Ball and a sunrise walk around the White House. It is not a didactic study on the problem of prostitution but a thought and discussion-provoking vehicle that probes the moral and social values involved.

results.title: Hard rubbish
results.brief_description:
A look at everyday life in one community and how it transforms waste into a valuable commodity, from one individual’s discarded object to another’s newly claimed prize possession. Several residents offer their personal insights to curbside recycling or as one discerning person calls it “free-ranging rubbish”, adding that there is a definite rubbish etiquette to be followed.
Music composed and performed by Irma Frieda.
